description: Subdivision of an existing three-unit warehouse (Use Class B8) into six warehouse/ storage units (Use Class B8); and associated internal and external alterations.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings:

Location plan, Sheet 4 of 6 - Proposed ground floor plan, Sheet 4 of 6 - Proposed first floor plan, Sheet 5 of 6 - Proposed elevations, DCAC 004 Rev 4 - Existing ground floor plan, DCAC 005 Rev 4 - Existing first floor plan, DCAC 006 Rev 4 - Existing elevations and side profile, Transport statement, Planning statement,
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| A minimum of five (5) secure and lockable long stay cycle parking spaces and three (3) short stay cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate cycle parking facilities for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) or the provisions of The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2020, the development shall only be used for storage and distribution (Use Class B8) purposes hereby approved, and not for any other use falling within Use Class E, nor shall the hereby approved units be further subdivided, without prior approval from the Local Planning Authority through a planning application, except where indicated on the hereby approved plans listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality and provision of any change of use, to ensure the future protection, viability and integrity of the wider Locally Significant Industrial Site in accordance with policies E4, E5, E6 and E7 of the London Plan (2021), policy 4A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
